page.title: 16Drainage at Stretton Heath.
page.content: { Mr.Hemmings,Pear Tree Farm,Stretton {Heath,}and some of his neighbours are draining part of their land.The drain- age needs to be improved so that they can grow crops there.Before it was only used for rough grazing. The pipes came from{Ireland}and cost {Â£14 per metre.}If they had bought them from Bridgnorth,Shropshire they would have cost{Â£24 per metre. The pipes go down from 1 metre to 5 and a half metres deep.The water will drain to Ford and Cardeston.The bould- er clay will go to people who want it for their gardens and some will line a silage pit and fill in ditches.The machines which were used were a J.C.B. a Hymac,a stone trailer and four trac- tors.After the land is drained it will be used to grow wheat,barley and crops to feed livestock.They will be able to use heavier machines on the land.
